intro: Erysimum fussianum, commonly known as the alpine wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, hairy leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained, rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine meadows and slopes. Erysimum fussianum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to bloom in harsh, high-altitude environments.
